title: Top 10 ReFi Projects on Celo 🙌
html:
ReFi on Celo

ReFi, or Regenerative Finance, is a new paradigm of finance that aims to create positive social and environmental impact through decentralized platforms. Unlike traditional finance, which often prioritizes profit over people and planet, ReFi aligns incentives with the common good and rewards actions that contribute to solving systemic challenges like climate change, poverty, and inequality.

ReFi is not just a theoretical concept, but a practical reality that is being implemented by various projects on the Celo blockchain. Celo is a carbon-negative, mobile-first, EVM-compatible blockchain ecosystem that enables anyone with a smartphone to access the benefits of crypto and DeFi. Celo’s vision is to create prosperity for all by fostering a thriving digital economy that is inclusive, sustainable, and resilient.

In this blog post, we will introduce you to the top 10 ReFi projects on the Celo blockchain that are making a difference in the world. These projects range from payments to lending to governance, and showcase the diversity and innovation of the Celo community.

1. Moola Market

Moola Market is a decentralized money market protocol that allows users to lend and borrow crypto assets on Celo. Moola Market leverages Celo’s stablecoins (cUSD and cEUR) and native token (CELO) to provide low-cost and accessible liquidity to users around the world. Moola Market also supports social impact initiatives by donating a portion of its protocol fees to carbon offset projects and community grants.

Moola Market was founded by Patrick Baron, Zviad Metreveli, Asa Oines, and James Prestwich in 2020. It has raised $3 million in seed funding from investors like Polychain Capital, Andreesen Horowitz, Electric Capital, and Dragonfly Capital.

2. Ubeswap

Ubeswap is a decentralized exchange (DEX) that allows users to swap tokens, provide liquidity, and earn fees on Celo. Ubeswap leverages Celo’s fast and cheap transactions to offer a seamless and user-friendly trading experience. Ubeswap also supports social impact initiatives by integrating carbon offsetting into its platform and donating a portion of its protocol fees to community causes.

Ubeswap was founded by Evan Kuo and Samyak Jain in 2020. It has raised $1 million in seed funding from investors like Electric Capital, Dragonfly Capital, Nascent Ventures, and The LAO.

3. Impact Market

Impact Market is a decentralized basic income platform that empowers communities to create and manage their own unconditional cash transfer programs on Celo. Impact Market leverages Celo’s mobile-first design and stablecoins to deliver direct and transparent aid to people in need around the world. Impact Market also supports social impact initiatives by measuring and reporting the outcomes of its programs and incentivizing donors with tax benefits.

Impact Market was founded by Diogo Silva, João Varela, Miguel Almeida, Pedro Almeida, Rui Rodrigues, and Tiago Alves in 2020. It has raised $2 million in seed funding from investors like cLabs, Electric Capital, Nascent Ventures, Lemniscap, and The Giving Block.

4. Valora

Valora is a mobile wallet app that allows users to send and receive money globally on Celo. Valora leverages Celo’s stablecoins (cUSD and cEUR) and phone number verification system to offer a simple and secure way to transact with anyone in the world. Valora also supports social impact initiatives by enabling users to donate to causes they care about and rewarding them with cashback rewards.

Valora was founded by Jackie Bona in 2020 as an independent spin-off from cLabs, the company behind Celo’s core protocol development. It has raised $20 million in Series A funding from investors like Andreesen Horowitz, Polychain Capital, SV Angel, Nima Capital, NFX, Valor Capital Group, Verison Ventures, Slow Ventures, and others.

5. Mento

Mento is a decentralized algorithmic reserve-backed stablecoin exchange protocol that maintains the peg of Celo’s stablecoins (cUSD and cEUR) to their respective fiat currencies. Mento leverages Celo’s native token (CELO)

6. Loam

Loam is a decentralized marketplace for farming data that incentivizes farmers to engage in regenerative practices. Loam leverages Celo’s stablecoins and native token to reward farmers for sharing their data on soil health, crop yield, carbon sequestration, and other metrics. Loam also supports social impact initiatives by enabling data buyers to fund projects that improve the livelihoods of farmers and the environment.

Loam was founded by Alexandra Griffen and Evan Kuo in 2020. It has raised $4 million in seed funding from investors like Electric Capital, Dragonfly Capital, Nascent Ventures, and The LAO.

7. Circular Impact

Circular Impact is a platform that enables circular economy companies to quantify and monetize their positive impact using Web3 infrastructure. Circular Impact leverages Celo’s stablecoins and native token to reward companies for reducing waste, emissions, and resource consumption. Circular Impact also supports social impact initiatives by creating a transparent and verifiable marketplace for impact tokens that can be traded or donated.

Circular Impact was founded by Sanergy, a social enterprise that provides safe sanitation solutions in Kenya, and Celo, a blockchain ecosystem that enables financial inclusion and sustainability. It has raised $1 million in seed funding from investors like cLabs, Electric Capital, Nascent Ventures, Lemniscap, and The Giving Block.

8. Wren

Wren is a platform that allows users to offset their carbon footprint by funding projects that protect and restore nature. Wren leverages Celo’s stablecoins and native token to enable users to pay for their offsets in crypto and track their impact on the blockchain. Wren also supports social impact initiatives by partnering with vetted projects that create co-benefits for communities and biodiversity.

Wren was founded by Landon Brand, Ben Stanfield, and Mimi Tran Zambetti in 2020. It has raised $3 million in seed funding from investors like Union Square Ventures, Version One Ventures, Homebrew, Collaborative Fund, and others.

9. Moss

Moss is a platform that allows users to buy and sell carbon credits on the blockchain. Moss leverages Celo’s stablecoins and native token to enable users to access the global carbon market and support projects that reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Moss also supports social impact initiatives by creating a transparent and efficient marketplace for carbon credits that can be used for compliance or voluntary purposes.

Moss was founded by Luis Felipe Adaime in 2020. It has raised $10 million in Series A funding from investors like Valor Capital Group, Monashees, Foundation Capital, Coinbase Ventures, IDEO CoLab Ventures, and others.

10. Umoja

Umoja is a platform that allows users to access financial services on Celo without a bank account or credit history. Umoja leverages Celo’s stablecoins and native token to enable users to save, borrow, invest, and send money across borders. Umoja also supports social impact initiatives by empowering unbanked and underbanked populations with financial inclusion and literacy.

Umoja was founded by Abdulaziz Mohamed and Abdikadir Aden in 2020. It has raised $500k in seed funding from investors like cLabs, Electric Capital, Nascent Ventures, Lemniscap, and The Giving Block.

Conclusion

These are just some of the ReFi projects on Celo that are making a difference in the world. There are many more projects that are not listed here but are equally inspiring and impactful. If you want to learn more about ReFi on Celo or join the movement, you can visit https://celo.org/refi or follow @CeloOrg on Twitter.

An Exciting Future for ReFi ✨

The sustainable technology space is full of innovation and creativity. Each one of these exciting projects is solving important problems and contributing to a more sustainable, just, and prosperous world. We are proud to highlight their work and excited to see what they will achieve in the future.
